intro: Ruehssia amorimii, commonly known as the Amorim's ruehssia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the specific microclimatic conditions of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered critically endangered. Its botanical features make it an important subject for conservation and ecological studies.
